name: BrainFluff (Science fair)
description:
Brainfluff is a science fair project that is meant to teach kids about physics.

There's not much I can type here other than you can play it before December 4th if you want.

Even though the controls are already in the game itself, I really wanted to fill the description with something. Here are the controls.

  • 1 - Play world.
  • 2 - Pause world.
  • 3 - Reset world.
  • M - Open menu.
  • Left and Right keys - Adjust the sliders.
  • Up and down keys - Select a slider.
  • N - Get details on what a slider does.
  • Right-click - Select an object.
  • Left-click + Drag - Drag an object.
  • Control + Mouse movement - Rotate a selected object.
  • Alt - Delete a selected object

I apologize if there is not enough content in this game. There's only so much you can do with Gamemaker physics. :(

Here's what I think are the system requirements:

  • Windows 7, 8, or 10. Microsoft doesn't support Windows 7 but we do ;)
  • 1 GB RAM
  • Storage: 6 MB
  • You'd have to have a computer from the stone age if you can't run this.

If this gets popular enough I might turn this into an actual game. (But this time with a different game engine.) But what do you think?
